name: Companies that introduced new or significantly improved products and sales from products, by industry, industry proportions, and company size: 2013–15
description: Companies that introduced new or significantly improved products and sales from products, by industry, industry proportions, and company size: 2013–15

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: field_new_to_company_s_market_companies_number_d
variableMeasured.description: New To Company S Market Companies Number D

variableMeasured.name: field_new_to_company_s_market_sales
variableMeasured.description: New To Company S Market Sales

variableMeasured.name: field_new_only_to_company_companies_number_d_
variableMeasured.description: New Only To Company Companies Number D

variableMeasured.name: field_sales_of_products_unchanged_or_marginally_modified
variableMeasured.description: Sales Of Products Unchanged Or Marginally Modified

specialValues.D: suppressed to avoid disclosure of confidential information

notes: Detail may not add to total because of rounding. Industry classification is based on the dominant business code for domestic R&D performance, where available. For companies that did not report business codes, the classification used for sampling was assigned. Sum of "Yes" and "No" responses may not add to the total number of companies or, for the percentages, to 100% due to item nonresponse to some items.
sources: National Science Foundation, National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics, and U.S. Census Bureau, Business R&D and Innovation Survey.
